title.value: NeoRS: A Neonatal Resting State fMRI Data Preprocessing Pipeline
title.justification: The title "NeoRS: A Neonatal Resting State fMRI Data Preprocessing Pipeline" can be found in multiple instances such as the correspondence, paper title, and citation section.
title.quote: TITLE: NeoRS: A Neonatal Resting State fMRI Data Preprocessing Pipeline

extractions.description: This paper introduces NeoRS, a specialized preprocessing pipeline for neonatal resting-state fMRI data. NeoRS is designed to address the unique challenges posed by neonatal brain imaging, including variability in brain size and contrast differences due to myelination that make adult pipelines unsuitable. Developed as an open-source tool, NeoRS integrates popular neuroimaging tools like FSL, AFNI, and SPM. It supports parallel computing via Matlab to expedite processing and includes functionalities for data preprocessing, quality control, and functional connectivity analysis. Evaluated using Baby Connectome Project data, NeoRS facilitates robust and adaptable rsfMRI data analysis for neonates.

type.justification: The paper describes the development and evaluation of the NeoRS preprocessing pipeline, which is indicative of empirical research focused on practical application and data processing.
type.quote: To assess the effectiveness of NeoRS processing steps we used the neonatal data from the Baby Connectome Project dataset including a total of 10 neonates.

name.justification: The paper focuses on a preprocessing pipeline for resting-state functional MRI (rsfMRI) data, which is a key topic within the field of neuroimaging.
name.quote: NeoRS: A Neonatal Resting State fMRI Data Preprocessing Pipeline

name.justification: The paper specifically addresses preprocessing of resting-state functional MRI data.
name.quote: Resting state functional MRI (rsfMRI) has been shown to be a promising tool to study intrinsic brain functional connectivity and assess its integrity in cerebral development.

name.justification: The paper specifies using neonatal data from the Baby Connectome Project to evaluate the NeoRS pipeline.
name.quote: To assess the effectiveness of NeoRS processing steps we used the neonatal data from the Baby Connectome Project dataset including a total of 10 neonates.
